# Death to globals ## Reduce global variables with debug.js
## What is debug.js ### Bunch of tool to help debug js * strong type checking * private property * assert which stop * GC monitor * and [more](https://github.com/jeromeetienne/debug.js)
## Globals are BAD "do not hit a namespace which doesnt belong to you" * globals are shared by everybody * they typically dont even know of the others * if those 2 pick the same name, conflict occurs * then debug horror occurs
## Globals are BAD * suppose 2 libraries * both like to use globals * **horror**: they pick the same name * Conflict happens * and devs needs to rewrite one of them... # GASP
## How to avoid Globals "prefix them" * if you library is called "jQuery" * put all your stuff behind it ``` jQuery.fn.foo = function(){ return 'bar'; } ```
## How to avoid Globals "do not hit a namespace which doesnt belong to you" ``` String.prototype.slugify = function(){ // ... your code here ... } ``` * you want to add a function in a existing object * say *.slugify()* in String * another lib did the same * both collides * hard to diagnose and fix # NO NO
